text: Cameron Barker (born April 4, 1986 in Winnipeg, Manitoba) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey defenceman. He played with the Chicago Blackhawks, Minnesota Wild, Edmonton Oilers, and Vancouver Canucks of the National Hockey League (NHL). He has also played with Barys Astana of the Kontinental Hockey League (KHL). Barker was drafted 3rd overall in the 2004 NHL Entry Draft by the Chicago Blackhawks. Barker played 5 seasons with the Blackhawks before being traded to the Minnesota Wild for Kim Johnsson and defensive prospect Nick Leddy. He played 2 seasons with the Wild and the Wild placed him on waivers on June 28, 2011. He signed a contract with the Edmonton Oilers on July 1, 2011. He played a season with the Oilers before being cut by the team on June 25, 2012. He joined the Texas Stars for 23 games before signing a $700,000, one-year contract with the Vancouver Canucks. ==Awards== *He was named to the WHL All-Rookie Team in 2003. *He won the Ed Chynoweth Cup championship with the Medicine Hat Tigers in 2004. *He won the World Junior gold medal in 2005 and 2006. ==Career statistics== Regular season Playoffs Season Team League GP G A Pts PIM GP G A Pts PIM 2001–02 Medicine Hat Tigers WHL 3 0 1 1 0 — — — — — 2002-02 Medicine Hat Tigers WHL 64 10 37 47 79 11 3 4 7 17 2003-04 Medicine Hat Tigers WHL 69 21 44 65 105 20 3 9 12 18 2004-05 Medicine Hat Tigers NHL 52 15 33 48 99 12 3 3 6 16 2005-06 Medicine Hat Tigers WHL 26 5 13 18 63 13 4 8 12 59 2005-06 Chicago Blackhawks NHL 1 0 0 0 0 — — — — — 2006–07 Norfolk Admirals AHL 34 5 10 15 53 6 1 3 4 13 2006–07 Chicago Blackhawks NHL 35 1 7 8 44 — — — — — 2007-08 Rockford IceHogs AHL 29 8 11 19 67 — — — — — 2007–08 Chicago Blackhawks NHL 45 6 12 18 52 — — — — — 2008–09 Chicago Blackhawks NHL 68 6 34 40 65 17 3 6 9 2 2009–10 Chicago Blackhawks NHL 51 4 10 14 58 — — — — — 2009–10 Minnesota Wild NHL 19 1 6 7 10 — — — — — 2010–11 Minnesota Wild NHL 52 1 4 5 34 — — — — — 2011–12 Edmonton Oilers NHL 25 2 0 2 23 — — — — — 2012–13 Texas Stars AHL 23 3 5 8 24 — — — — — 2012–13 Vancouver Canucks NHL 14 0 2 2 4 — — — — — NHL totals 310 21 75 96 290 17 6 3 9 2 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Edmonton Oilers players Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Medicine Hat Tigers players Category:Minnesota Wild players Category:Norfolk Admirals players Category:Rockford IceHogs (AHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg Category:Texas Stars players Category:Vancouver Canucks players
